Aubrey_Peeples:
{{short description|American actor and singer (born 1993)}} {{Infobox person | name = Aubrey Peeples | image = Aubrey Shea Peeples.jpg | image_size = | caption = Peeples in 2019 | birth_name = Aubrey Shea Peeples{{cite web|url=http://www.unitedarts.cc/docs/UA%20Donor%20Recognition%20List%202010%20_WEB_.pdf |title=Donor Recognition List |publisher=United Arts |year=2010 |accessdate=2014-01-16 }}{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|11|27}} | birth_place = [[Lake Mary, Florida]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, singer | years_active = 2009–present | website = }} '''Aubrey Shea Peeples''' (born November 27, 1993) is an American actor and singer. They are best known for portraying Layla Grant in the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] drama series ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]].'' They also led [[Carrie Brownstein]]'s pilot ''Search & Destroy'' for Hulu based on her band [[Sleater-Kinney]]. Peeples played the lead role in the musical film ''[[Jem and the Holograms (film)|Jem and the Holograms]]'' (2015). Their directorial and screenwriting debut, ''Decadeless'', premiered at the Portland Oregon Women's Film Festival in 2019. == Early life == Aubrey Shea Peeples was born and raised in [[Lake Mary, Florida]], by parents Wendy and Ashley,{{cite news |url= http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1993-12-26/news/9312230080_1_park-memorial-hospital-winter-seminole-hospital |title= Births |work= [[Orlando Sentinel]] |location= Orlando, Florida |date= December 26, 1993 |accessdate= 2014-01-16 |quote= Peeples, Aubrey Shea, born to Wendy and Ashley, Lake Mary, Winter Park Memorial Hospital |archive-date= 2015-07-11 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20150711014454/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1993-12-26/news/9312230080_1_park-memorial-hospital-winter-seminole-hospital |url-status= dead }}{{cite news |title= Check out this kid: Aubrey Peeples |url= http://www.bluetoad.com/publication/?i=21656&p=122 |work= Lake Mary Life |location=Lake Mary, Florida |first= Cherylann |last= Taramykin |date= September–October 2009 |accessdate= 2014-01-16 |quote= At 15, Aubrey … parents, Wendy and Ashley |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20150923192505/http://www.bluetoad.com/publication/?i=21656&p=122 |archive-date= 2015-09-23 |url-status= dead }} and has a younger sister named Ally. Growing up, Peeples performed with the [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]] Repertory Theatre for ten years.{{cite news |title= Lake Mary to Nashville |url= http://www.lakemarylife.com/articles/lake-mary-to-nashville/ |work= Lake Mary Life |location= Lake Mary, Florida |first= Kristen |last= Manieri |date= November 1, 2013 |accessdate= 2014-01-16 |quote= Aubrey Peeples … the 19-year-old actress from Lake Mary |archive-date= 2015-02-19 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20150219183615/http://www.lakemarylife.com/articles/lake-mary-to-nashville/ |url-status= dead }}{{cite news |title= 'Sharknado' sends Lake Mary actress flying |url= http://www.orlandosentinel.com/entertainment/blogs/tv-guy/os-sharknado-sends-lake-mary-actress-flying-20130801,0,5669901.post |work= Orlando Sentinel |location=Orlando, Florida |first= Hal |last= Boedeker |date= August 1, 2013 |accessdate= 2014-01-16 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20140225195653/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/entertainment/blogs/tv-guy/os-sharknado-sends-lake-mary-actress-flying-20130801,0,5669901.post |archive-date= 2014-02-25 |url-status= dead }} They graduated from [[Lake Mary Preparatory School]],{{cite web |title=LMP Graduate Achieves Recurring Role on ABC Hit Series, Nashville |url=http://www.lakemaryprep.com/podium/default.aspx?t=204&tn=LMP+Graduate+Achieves+Recurring+Role+on++ABC+Hit+Series%2C+Nashville&nid=863268&ptid=134873&sdb=False&pf=pgt&mode=0&vcm=False |publisher=Lake Mary Preparatory School |date=August 21, 2013 |access-date=January 16, 2014 |archive-date=February 21, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221114512/http://www.lakemaryprep.com/podium/default.aspx?t=204&tn=LMP+Graduate+Achieves+Recurring+Role+on++ABC+Hit+Series%2C+Nashville&nid=863268&ptid=134873&sdb=False&pf=pgt&mode=0&vcm=False }} where they were [[valedictorian]] of the class of 2012. Peeples was accepted to [[Harvard University]] but deferred entry twice, the second time to accept their role on ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''. == Career == Peeples has guest-starred in ''[[Drop Dead Diva]]'', ''[[Burn Notice]]'', ''[[Austin & Ally]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'', and had a recurring role on ''[[Necessary Roughness (TV series)|Necessary Roughness]]''. They also appeared in the made-for-television movies ''[[Ace Ventura Jr.: Pet Detective]]'', ''The Good Mother'' and ''[[Sharknado]]''. They were cast in a major recurring role, playing Layla Grant, a runner-up in a reality singing competition and rising country star, in the [[Nashville (season 2)|second season]] of the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] drama series ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''.{{cite magazine |last= Gonzalez |first= Maricela |url= http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/07/29/nashville-sharknado-actress-to-recur/ |title= 'Sharknado' actress reels in 'Nashville' role |magazine= Entertainment Weekly |date= July 29, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-09-27}}{{cite web |url= http://www.tvfanatic.com/2013/07/aubrey-peeples-to-keep-it-real-on-nashville/ |title= Aubrey Peeples to Keep It Real on Nashville |work = TV Fanatic |first= Matt |last= Richenthal |date= July 30, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-09-27}}{{cite web |url= http://www.wetpaint.com/nashville/articles/2013-07-31-aubrey-peeples-sharknado-nashville |title= Aubrey Peeples Heading From Sharknado to Nashville |work= Wetpaint |first= Carson |last= Blackwelder |date= July 31, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-09-27}}{{cite magazine |last= Gonzalez |first= Maricela |url= http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/09/25/nashville-season-2-premiere/ |title= 'Nashville' season premiere: 10 things you can expect this year |magazine= Entertainment Weekly |date= September 25, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-09-27}} They were later promoted to regular status for ''Nashville''{{'}}s fourth season.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2015/07/22/nashville-aubrey-peeples-series-regular-series-4/?iframe=true&theme_preview=true|title=Nashville Promotes Aubrey Peeples to Series Regular in season 4|first1=Kimberly|last1=Roots|work=[[TVLine]]|date=July 23, 2015}} However, Peeples did not return for the show's fifth season when ''Nashville'' moved to [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]].{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2016/06/nashville-will-chase-aubrey-peeples-depart-series-regulars-cmt-luke-layla-1201777905/|title='Nashville': Regulars Will Chase & Aubrey Peeples Depart As Series Moves To CMT|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=June 23, 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/06/22/nashville-season-5-will-chase-leaving-luke-cast/|title=Nashville Shakeup: Two Series Regulars Exit Ahead of Move to CMT|first1=Kimberly|last1=Roots|work=[[TVLine]]|date=June 23, 2016}} In 2014, Peeples was cast as Jerrica "Jem" Benton, in the romantic musical fantasy comedy-drama film ''[[Jem and the Holograms (film)|Jem and the Holograms]]'', based on the [[Jem (TV series)|1980s television show of the same name]].{{cite journal | url=http://www.people.com/article/jem-and-the-holograms-movie-cast-aubrey-peeples | title=Jem and the Holograms Cast Revealed: Meet the Actresses Behind the Band | journal=[[People (magazine)|People]] | first=Kelli|last=Bender | date=April 25, 2014 | accessdate=2015-12-17}} The same year Peeples co-starred in the crime thriller ''[[Rage (2014 film)|Rage]]'' opposite [[Nicolas Cage]].{{cite web |last= Papa |first= Brian |url= http://www.pageqsports.com/2013/07/podcast-interviews-aubrey-peeples/ |title= Interview With Sharknado's Aubrey Peeples |work= Page Q Sports |date= July 24, 2013 |accessdate= 2013-09-27}} In September 2014, Peeples was named one of the best actors under the age of twenty by [[IndieWire|Indiewire]].{{cite web|author=The Playlist Staff|title=On The Rise: 20 Actors To Watch That Are Under 20|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2014/09/on-the-rise-20-actors-to-watch-that-are-under-20-272876/|website=Indiewire|date=4 September 2014 |accessdate=February 16, 2017}} ==Personal life== In 2019, Peeples opened up about having [[bipolar disorder]] in an interview with ''NKD Magazine''.{{cite web |date=October 1, 2019 |url=https://issuu.com/nakedmag/docs/1-cover_14bf40ef03de5d/10 |title=NKD Mag - Issue #100 (The Final Issue) |publisher=[[issuu]] |accessdate=October 6, 2019 }} In November 2021, Peeples came out as [[queer]] and non-binary.{{cite web |title=Star of "Nashville" Aubrey Peeples Comes Out As Fem Non-binary On Podcast |url=https://www.prlog.org/12893915-star-of-nashville-aubrey-peeples-comes-out-as-fem-non-binary-on-podcast.html |website=www.prlog.org}} They use [[they/them]] pronouns.{{cite web |title=heypeeplesitsaubrey Aubrey Shea they/them #blm • QUEER •nonbinary @s_w_a_m_p_z @teeth.wav @acceptance.film |url=https://www.instagram.com/heypeeplesitsaubrey/ |website=instagram.com}} ==
